H0.text: Lab coat is the additional protective equipment the student should use, besides goggles and gloves, to conduct the investigation safely with chemicals.

H1.text: A petri dish should be used, in addition to goggles and gloves, by a student conducting an investigation with chemicals to ensure the work is performed safely.

H2.text: The Bunsen burner is the equipment the student should use, in addition to goggles and gloves, to conduct the investigation safely.

A4.text: In laboratory work, lab coats protect against accidental spills, e.g., acids. In this case, they usually have long sleeves and are made of absorbent material, such as cotton, so that the user can be protected from the chemical.

A5.text: Some lab coats have buttons or elastic at the end of the sleeves, to secure them around the wrist so that they do not hang into containers of chemicals or tip over lab equipment.
